Class MyMenuDemo

  • java.lang.Object
    • MyMenuDemo

  • class MyMenuDemo
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the entry point for the system. If this class is ran with a command line file name argument, it will skip the graphical user interface and proceed directly to the election process. If there was no command line argument, this class with provide a simple awt graphical interface. The user can either enter the file name through popup or open a file explorer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MyMenuDemo

        MyMenuDemo()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        This generates the initial gui window. creates a Frame that is shown to the user. Additionally, it also creates menu items that allows users to select whether to input filename or search for it with a file finder.

      • myDisplay

        private void myDisplay()
        This is a test function to experiment with displays.

      • myEvent

        private void myEvent()
        This is a private function. It creates a SearchFile instance that is used to as a file explorer for the user to find files on the disk/directory.

      • getCommand

        public static boolean getCommand()
        Returns:
        command is a boolean for testing to see if there was command line argument.

      • testEvent

        public boolean testEvent()
        This is a wrapper test function to test myEvent.
        Returns:
        boolean value indicating the file finder was opened.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the entry function for the system. It will launch a GUI if there is no input from args. If args is not empty, it will take the first entry of args and attempt to read that filename.
        Parameters:
        args - Possible file name argument. Only args[0] is checked so the command line input must be precise.
